A harvest festival runs through Oct. 15 at Greig Farm on Pitcher Lane in Red Hook, N.Y., in the Hudson Valley. Every weekend, there will be farm tours, food for sale and a three-acre corn maze, with charges for some activities: (914) 758-1234.

White truffle dinners will be served at the Italian Culinary Center, 230 Fifth Avenue (27th Street), on Oct. 11, 12, 18 and 19 from 7 to 9:30 p.m., with a different guest chef in the kitchen each night. The cost is $100 for members and $150 for nonmembers. Reservations: (212) 725-8764, extension 48.

Unlike many other European cooking courses, the ones that are offered at Corsi di Cucina, the school of Margherita and Valeria Simili in Bologna, Italy, are given in single sessions, so that it is not necessary to plan a full week's vacation around a cooking school. Most subjects are covered, in Italian, in one or two morning lessons, which are then followed by lunch. The cost for each session in the new fall schedule is about $65. Information: (011) 39-051-55-44-94.

A dinner to raise money for the preservation of the cookbook collection of the New York Public Library will be given on Oct. 15 at 6 p.m. at the James Beard Foundation, 167 West 12th Street. Rocco DiSpirito of Union Pacific will prepare the evening's dinner, which costs $250 for members and $300 for nonmembers Reservations: (212) 627-2308.

The Wine Spectator will offer a tasting of more than 200 California wines at the Marriott Marquis on Oct. 19 from 8 to 10 p.m. and again on Oct. 20. Tickets, $175, will benefit the magazine's wine scholarship program. Reservations: (212) 684-4224 or www.winespectator.com.
